have them there to plot underlying our data if you wanted to compare to WHO curves

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
# Load WHO growth reference data
who_girls_bmi_5_to_19 <- read.csv("C://Users/User/Downloads/bmi-girls-perc-who2007-exp.csv")


# Plot WHO percentiles
ggplot(who_girls, aes(x = Month)) +
  geom_line(aes(y = P3), linetype = "dashed", color = "black") +
  geom_line(aes(y = P15), linetype = "dashed", color = "orange") +
  geom_line(aes(y = P50), linetype = "dashed", color = "black", size = 1) +  # Median
  geom_line(aes(y = P85), linetype = "dashed", color = "orange") +
  geom_line(aes(y = P97), linetype = "dashed", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "WHO Height-for-Age Growth Chart (Girls, 5â€“19 years)",
       x = "Age (Months)", y = "Height (cm)") +
  theme_minimal()


```
